attributes.action: Any EU national came after BREXIT referendum Should not get right to Stay in UK
attributes.background:
UK is already overcrowded,
NHS is streched, 
British Family is struggling to get choice of education as schools are already over crowded, 
EU haven't provided guarantee for UK national so why should uk give guarantee for EU national
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority has said the EU membership fee figure of £19 billion a year, or £350 million a week,
The UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Britons' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU,even though there are significantly more EU citizens in the UK than UK citizens in the EU.
For example the UK pays France £147,685,772, but France only pays UK £6,730,292 and the UK pays Germany £25,873,954 but Germany only pays the UK £2,189,664

attributes.action: hold referendum on ending public financing of the royal family.
attributes.background: redecorating Buckingham palace will cost the taxpayer 367 million pounds, why isn't this very wealthy family responsible for the maintenance of the properties they live in? A referendum should be held for us to decide if they should continue to receive any finance from British taxpayers.

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: Ban cropping/clipping of a dog's ears
attributes.background: Ban the cropping/clipping of a dogs ears, unless it's for medical reasons. Most commonly seen in pit breeds, cropping a puppies ears purely for cosmetic reasons is mutilation. It's cruel and serves no purpose for their health. Only for the owners enjoyment.

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Fund the NHS by increasing income-tax by 2 pence in the pound.
attributes.background: The NHS is on its knees, it requires reorganisation which means a lot more funding than is currently available from the Government purses.  We ALL benefit from the NHS and we CANNOT allow it to fall 'unfit for purpose'. "Once it has gone - there will be no turning back"
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS should be free service to all UK citizens and that is true in most cases however, 'nothing is free in life'. If we want to be able to visit a doctor when we feel ill or go to Casualty, when our child or other loved one has suffered a serious injury or perhaps receive cancer treatment or other medical care - maybe we need to call an ambulance in an emergency, we need to keep and fund the NHS.

To keep this service the NHS has to be paid for!!!

Working people could pay 2 pence in the pound  & those of us receiving State benefits & pensions to have 2% deducted at source.

 I want my grandchildren to be able to have access to a good NHS but we must all do our bit to pay for. 

Please sign this petition to help us achieve it.

attributes.action: Make housing affordable for everyone living in council and private accommodation
attributes.background: Renting properties whether, it be council or private are becoming more & more expensive, with the living minimum wage at £7.20ph (on average) this makes living an impossible task. More & more families are left with a decision to either pay their rent or feed their family.
attributes.additional_details: Rent costs are forever increasing yet the minimum wage isn't. with the rent increasing to the amount a mortgage would cost, families are forced to choose between feeding their family or pay the rent, with failure to pay rent, evictions have soared and so has stress and suicide. an average person on minimum wage £7.20ph 40hrs a week = £288 x 4 weeks=£1,152 - tax 20% basic rate = £960 deduct rent, minimum start £450= £510 council tax average £75pm = £435 this is what is left each month on average.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for the government to borrow from the National Insurance Fund
attributes.background: Government borrows surplus set aside for welfare to pay off the National Debt. It is estimated that they owe the NI fund £24 billion. NI money can only be used to fund NHS and welfare. The Government gets around this by lending money to itself, spending elsewhere instead of properly funding the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/560695/National_Insurance_Fund_Accounts_Great_Britain_2015_to_2016.pdf

attributes.action: Introduce a mandatory refresher course and driving test for people over 70
attributes.background:
Far too often we hear of older drivers who have lost control of their car and caused serious damage to themselves and others, sometimes killing people. 

Many know their elderly relatives are no longer fit for driving but are unable to stop them from getting behind a wheel.
attributes.additional_details:
To make our roads safer and help avoid these tragedies we should introduce a mandatory test to make sure drivers are still fit to be on the road. 

These courses, tests and lessons will provide additional income and help protect the public from accidents that could have been avoided.

attributes.action: Apply diplomatic pressure on China to stop repatriating North Koreans.
attributes.background: North Koreans are suffering at the hands of a tyrannical regime. They are starving. Many do not have access to basic commodities, are not free to talk or act as they choose and are in fear of severe punishment. Many escape to China to find freedom, they are often exploited by traffickers or sold.
attributes.additional_details:
If they are found by the Chinese authorities they are sent back to North Korea where they are punished as defectors (e.g. life imprisonment in deplorable conditions). Repatriating refugees in this way is a clear violation of human rights and they should be allowed safe passage through China to a country who will accept them (e.g. South Korea).
http://www.libertyinnorthkorea.org/
http://www.nkfreedom.org/index.aspx
http://www.northkoreanrefugees.com/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ei-gGvLWOZI

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a service provider to have a premium rate phone number.
attributes.background: Make it illegal for service providers to have a premium rate phone number so contacting them regarding their services is of great personal cost. This should cover, delivery companies, all house hold bills and any shops that you need to contact for any reason relating to a goods or service bought.

attributes.action: Ban the use of meat and dairy produce at all government functions and meals
attributes.background: Meat and dairy is the greatest contributor to greenhouse gases. It is also a driver of rainforest destruction. It condemns billions of sentient animals to confined lives and a violent death. It is urgent that the UK government takes a lead in adopting Vegan diets for official functions and meals

attributes.action: Allow people who are born blind in one eye, to register as partially sighted.
attributes.background: If you are born with eyesight in one eye you, cant register as partially sighted unless you have problems with your other eye.

attributes.action: Create abandoned buildings suitable for the homeless
attributes.background: To many people are living on the streets, we have so many abandoned buildings that arnt being used at all we need to open these buildings for the homeless, free of charge or affordable for them.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Main Home
attributes.background: People need to move house for many reasons, job, health, family, personal circumstances change etc. they should be able to move easily, without a financial penalty being paid to the government. But they can't because of stamp duty. It locks people in unsuitable homes and restricts movement.
attributes.additional_details: Most have to add the stamp duty tax to their mortgage. How can taking out a loan for 25-30 years to pay the government for the privilege of moving home be right. Stamp duty tax is damaging the property market, peoples lives & the economy. Many people that want to, or need to move cannot, simply because of the enormous cost of stamp duty. Stamp Duty tax needs to be abolished.

attributes.action: Clerks of the House of Commons to continue wearing wigs and court dress
attributes.background: We believe that changes to the attire of the clerks after the February recess fail to take account of the traditions of the House of Commons.  The so called 'executive order' needs to be debated be repealed.  It ain't broke, so don't fix it

attributes.action: Apply VAT on airfares to better fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is underfunded; at the end of 2015/16 the NHS had a deficit of £1.85 billion. Aviation is lightly taxed but harmful, eg it impairs children's learning ability and is detrimental to wildlife. It is also exacerbating our climate crisis and in 2014 produced over 11% of the UK’s total emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
Airline passengers do not pay fuel duty or VAT and APD can be as low as £13. We might think this makes annual holidays affordable but in fact undertaxed flights largely benefit affluent people who fly several times a year; 70% of flights are taken by only 15% of adults.

My petition is to apply VAT on airfares and for the additional revenue to be used to support our NHS. Most of us like an annual holiday but those of us who can afford 2 to 3 holidays each year can also afford to pay more tax.

attributes.action: Make toll roads free for HGV's
attributes.background: With rising costs associated with running haulage companies including fuel, road tax, operator licence fees e.t.c toll roads are a cost that should be wavered for HGV. A prime example being the M6 toll. Allowing HGV'S to use this for free would have a massively positive impact on congestion.

attributes.action: Reinstate the Nit Nurse and make lice treatments free for children up to age 16
attributes.background: The lack of nit education and Nit treatments being taken off the minor ailment scheme results in more infestations and less treatment being administered. With most brands of treatment ranging from £8-£15 per treatment it is a costly affair to treat the whole family effectively.
attributes.additional_details: The reinstatement of the Nit Nurse in all primary schools and the access to free head lice treatment will go a long way to combat the problem.

attributes.action: Form cross party committee to agree strategy & funding of the NHS & care support
attributes.background: We need to agree a long term strategy for the NHS, to ensure we maximise our incredible resources and expertise. We have difficult choices to make: modernising to ensure we offer a consistent 7 day service; identify a way to fund the increasing demand; and how we fund elderly care in the community.
attributes.additional_details:
We have an increasingly ageing population with improved medical advances. The service needs to remove the administrative burdens and focus on efficient world class care, which will require moving to a manufacturing shift pattern impacting ALL staff, requiring cross party support. 
To maximise the use of hospital beds we need to review the control & funding of aftercare/nursing homes to ensure quality and remove the bottlenecks between the NHS and local authorities, changes to tax structure?

attributes.action: Compel energy providers to offer the cheapest tariffs on pre-pay meters.
attributes.background: Users of pre-pay meters are unfairly disadvantaged when purchasing energy to heat their homes. Although often on lower incomes they actually have to pay a higher rate. This is "fuel poverty" - higher tariffs result in people going without food or other essentials as they just try to keep warm.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/19/fuel-poverty-heating-disabled-cold-penalised-energy-tariff

attributes.action: Stop bombing syria and provide support.
attributes.background: In syria a child's life is worth a bullet in the chamber of a soldier, the lives of all the mothers and children that die are only seen as colletral damage to the superpowers of the world, thats why i believe support from the united kingdom would be of much help to re-developing a nation.

attributes.action: Make all motorway matrix signs read Keep Left Unless Overtaking when not in use
attributes.background: Middle-lane-sitting is a common problem for many motorway users, and often results on excessive overtaking speed, undertaking, road rage and congestion. I think this problem is largely caused by ignorance of proper road use and could be eased by instructing drivers to keep left using overhead signs.
attributes.additional_details: As stated in the Highway Code (goo.gl/zagJKH) road users should keep left on the motorway and move back to the left as soon as they have overtaken, however for many drivers it has been years since they learned this rule. The result of this is poor road use resulting in heavy congestion and frustration for others. The overhead announcement boards could easily be used, when not displaying live notices, to say "Keep Left Unless Overtaking" to remind road users of how to use the motorways properly.

attributes.action: Legalise the pharmaceutical production of THC for medicinal purposes.
attributes.background: Across the world THC has been proven to benefit a massive range of medical issues, from Anxiety disorders to Parkinson's disease. It is a neuropathic relaxant and can give those in need more control therefore enhancing their wellbeing, independence and reduces the use of other treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against this is the fear of drug abuse - which is already unregulated and rife. Unlike alcohol and tobacco; there is no evidence of overdose, violence or suicide under the influence of THC. It's neuropathic relaxants enhance endorphins.
In legalising the pharmaceutical production, companies can create a medicated and prescribable form of THC which can be monitored and managed by clinicians.
Presently, there are no controls and those in medical need suffer in desperation.

attributes.action: Set up of a Men's Equality committee to address issues like male rape & suicide.
attributes.background:
There is already a Women & Equalities Committee, but it has not yet done any inquiries into issues facing men, such as; 
1* Suicide (three times as high in men) 
2* Male rape (where services for men are insufficient) 
3* Domestic violence against men (misreported as only affecting women).
attributes.additional_details:
1. suicide rates by gender 16.8 per 100,000 for men and 5.2 per 100,000 for women from Samaritans website http://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide 
2. 85,000 women and 12,000 men raped per year. http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
3. 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men - http://www.lwa.org.uk/understanding-abuse/statistics.htm”

attributes.action: Education funding should be ring fenced pupils funded equally.
attributes.background: Changes announced today (14 December) in the way schools will be funded in the future is just robbing Peter to pay Paul. Children are our future and they should be educated equally whenever they live.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are oversubscribed in some areas and others undersubscribed however equal funding would  hopefully address this problem and enable heads to allocate funding according to the needs of their pupils.

attributes.action: Evacuate Aleppo with joint UN task force, giving refuge in Britain to citizens.
attributes.background: The city of Aleppo has been conquered by the dictator Assad. His forces are massacring its people - men, women and children. It is preventable. Ask the government to petition a UN/EU task force to immediately go into the city as peacekeepers, not to directly fight Assad, but to evacuate citizens.
attributes.additional_details: All over twitter, Aleppo refugees are posting how the government is murdering them en masse. Innocent men, women and children. The UN must condemn the massacre as against international law, and the UN, failing them the EU, failing that Britain alone, mut notify Assad of its intent, and send a task force to the city. Not to fight Assad's forces directly, but to advise his troops to not engage, & to protect any citizen fleeing the city against his troops, withdrawing when the people are removed.

attributes.action: A  Vote of No Confidence in the Transport Secretary re Southern Railways dispute
attributes.background: The Transport Secretary has made it clear  he has no interest in the Southern/RMT/ASLEF rail dispute. People have lost their jobs, been refused job interviews & in some cases missed hospital appointments. His lack of action is grossly negligent and he should no longer be a government minister.

attributes.action: Provide anonymity for those accused of sexual assault until they're found guilty
attributes.background: While we find complete sympathy with all men and women who have been raped, the anonymity provided to the accusers must be extended to the accused until a verdict is reached. Careers are easily destroyed on allegations alone - even when the accused is found innocent. The imbalance is unjustifiable.
attributes.additional_details: In many circumstances in the past careers and livelihoods have been ruined by such allegations - even when the accused were eventually found innocent in a court of law. For many of the same reasons that the accusers are granted anonymity, we should extend this to accused to allow them protection from public scrutiny until they are found guilty.

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses

attributes.action: Resurface the A11 between Attleborough Wymondham
attributes.background: The government are talking about spending 3 plus billion pounds on improving congested roads, not a bad thing. But we have a stretch of road between that the surface is diabolic it is dangerous for all road uses, it desperately needs doing before some gets killed.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the section is made from concrete, when cracks, pot holes etc. Appear they are being patch with tarmac, as soon as the weather is bad these repair break down and the holes reappear.

attributes.action: Reinstate legal aid for students and people on a low income
attributes.background: Many people need the help of solicitors and courts all around the UK for various reasons but can't afford the costs by themselves. The 1st of April 2013 saw legal aid was discontinued. This petition will see that people are able to receive help in many cases that legal aid covered.
attributes.additional_details:
When legal aid was discontinued this meant some types of case were no longer eligible for public funds - including divorce, child contact, welfare benefits, employment, clinical negligence, and housing law except in very limited circumstances. (BBC news) 
This petition should be looked into by Houses of Parliament and even if only a few were reinstated for legal aid such as child contact being the main issue as every parent and child should be together and some parents can't afford legal costs.

attributes.action: Make it law for companies to let applicants know if they have got a job or not.
attributes.background: When we apply for a job many of us find that we don't hear a thing back from the company concerned.  This has to stop, not only is it downright rude of a company/employer small or large to not tell people if they did not get a job.  I think it also has a negative affect on confidence.

attributes.action: To make November 11th a bank holiday
attributes.background: To remember all the fallen heros

attributes.action: Change the way child maintenance payments are assessed and calculated.
attributes.background:
Currently the child maintenance system is calculated on a percentage based on what the paying parent earns.
https://www.gov.uk/how-child-maintenance-is-worked-out/how-the-child-maintenance-service-works-out-child-maintenance
attributes.additional_details: parents should contribute to what it costs to raise a child and not a percentage of their wage. Many find ways to avoid paying child maintenace due to the current calculation.Many receiving abuse the system and spend the income on other stuff other than the child. There should be a national avg amount calculated of what it costs to bring up a child and this amount should be split equally between the parents minus any child benefits the mother received and should be based on the age of the child.

attributes.action: Create a national database to check who has a current DBS certificate.
attributes.background: I believe there is a massive loophole, which potential allows paedophiles and other inappropriate adults access to the most vulnerable in our society. As parents/guardians we no right to check DBS certificates are in place. Neither the Charity Commission or the DBS check they have been done.
attributes.additional_details: I had reason to ask for confirmation that DBS certificates were in place at a charity my sister attends (she is a vulnerable adult). They refused, their response to my request was to threaten to report me to the Police for harassment. The charity is now being investigated by SAFA - Hertfordshire Police unit responsible for 'Safeguarding Adults from Abuse'due to serious Safeguarding issues.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of breast screening from 50 to 30yrs old or even 20.
attributes.background:
I have heard the there is a big increase in breat cancer in younger women. Some cases of which its too late. 
By reducing the breast screening age it will in the long run save NHS costs but most importantly save lifes. I have had friends as young as 26 been disgnosed.
attributes.additional_details:
www.ons.gov.uk/peoplepopulationandcommunity/healthandsocialcare/conditionsanddiseases/bulletins/cancerregistrationstatisticsengland/2014

This is from 2014. But breast cancer is one of the ones that is on the increase. Can it be help? Can it be picked up sooner? 
The answer is yes if the the age for breast screening is reduced from 50 to 30 or even to 20.

attributes.action: Renationalise water.
attributes.background:
Stop investors from around the world profiting from a basic human need. 
Removing the profit margin, will reduce everyone's water bill.
attributes.additional_details: Do your own research online, form your own opinion, but when you decide renationalising water is a great idea, sign the petition!

attributes.action: Update the law, to allow subjects of unhappiness or same-sex adultery a divorce.
attributes.background: Laws surrounding divorce in the UK are woefully outdated. UK courts neither recognise same-sex adultery, nor blatant unhappiness as suitable grounds for divorce. As a supposedly progressive country, we need to give unhappy people a choice, and take our divorce laws into the twenty-first century.
attributes.additional_details: In March 2017, Tini Owens, 66, lost her case at the court of appeal. She described herself as 'desperately unhappy' in her marriage of 39 years. She says her husband has been dismissive, insensitive, distrusting and generally unloving towards her for years. Even if Tini Owens is lying, and wants to leave her marriage - why should any court be in a position to stop her?! This is embarrassingly backward legislation, and needs reforming urgently.

attributes.action: Repeal the ban on laptops and tablets on flights from six Middle East countries
attributes.background:
The UK has banned laptops, tablets and similar devices "larger than a normal smartphone" on all direct passenger flights from Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Tunisia and Saudi Arabia.

Whilst they can be placed in the hold, for many this is an unacceptable and unfounded risk and inconvenience.
attributes.additional_details:
Students, professionals and others for whom their laptops represent an important part of their academic and/or working lives, will be asked to entrust their devices to the hold of the aircraft. 

Issues of theft or damage aside, to be parted from such a valuable device (both literally and figuratively) on such arbitrary grounds as those presented, is simply unacceptable.

I sadly, have come to expect such nonsense from Trump - but believe that we in the UK can do much better than this.

attributes.action: Prevent employers from banning religious/political symbols in the workplace
attributes.background: The ECJ has ruled that it is legal for employers to ban the wearing "any political, philosophical or religious sign" in the workplace. This is discriminatory, and will disproportionately affect religious minorities, particularly Muslim women. We call upon the government to reject the ECJ's ruling.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-39264845

attributes.action: Make all incontinence products available on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Many people across the UK, of all ages, suffer from bowel or bladder incontinence.
Across many areas, the NHS is lacking options available for people having to live with this condition.
We are offered adult nappies only,when there are other better options such as pull ups. Make those free on NHS.
attributes.additional_details: Bowel or bladder incontinence is a very difficult symptom to deal with. I believe many more adult continence products should be available from the NHS. Different people have different issues, and some products are suited to some, but not others. Give suffers the choice.

attributes.action: Hi my name is Caitlin gray and I would like to make  bullying against the law
attributes.background: People that get bullied can't handle it and want to end their life with no question about it and I want to change that I want to make it stop because we shouldn't have to deal with it so I would like to make bullying against the law.
attributes.additional_details:
My friend commited suicide due to bullying for being transgender.and on social media you could see young people have commited suicide because they cannot deal with bullying. I think it is wrong for us to have to end our life because we live in fear and dread of going to school or even out side. It needs to stop and I'm crying out for something to stop it and I feel strongly for this to be heard and stopped. People record it on there phones and laugh it's mostly on YouTube the bullying and its sad. I want it to stop I want someone to do something about it and not just brush it away like its nothing. We are to young to kill ourselves and we have a future and dreams.
Regards Caitlin Gray

attributes.action: Make teaching a nuanced account of the British Empire statutory in KS3 History
attributes.background: In their next revision of the national curriculum, the UK government should update Key Stage 3 history so that teaching about the British Empire is statutory. A nuanced account about the oppressive nature of the empire is needed to education those who are unaware of Britain's problematic empire

attributes.action: Change the standards for disabled travelling on all public transport.
attributes.background: At the moment most companies comply with the set standards for disabled travellers. But this isn't enough, one wheelchair space per bus or train often leaves disabled people waiting at station because the designated spot is full. There need to be more than one space. The bare minimum isn't enough.
attributes.additional_details: My brother is in a wheelchair he has often been left waiting for up to an hour because the space he needed was full. Also other people are left behind be he is in the space etc.

attributes.action: Standardise dress sizes
attributes.background: It's about time that we standardise dress sizes here in the UK. The fact that a woman could be a size 8 and a size 16 in the same shop is ridiculous.  This is 2017 and it's about time there were guidelines for suppliers to follow.
attributes.additional_details: This affects everyone from babies, woman of all ages, shapes and sizes to our young impressionable girls who already have to struggle with what the media tells them they have to look like.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax for people who are earning under £43,000 from 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: People all over the United Kingdom work very hard for their money that they earn, and are being taxed way too much. If 5% was reduced from the general tax rate, employees would be much happier with their jobs. Unemployed people will be more likely to work as the salary rates will be more appealing.

attributes.action: People to be fined if, deemed by paramedics that the call is not an emergency.
attributes.background: People are to be fined £150, if paramedics deem the call to be a non-emergency. To help prevent time-wasting calls across Britain. This will allow for the NHS to not be under as much pressure and abuse that they are now.
attributes.additional_details: Local news has shown, nurses, paramedics and other health care staff are abused on a regular basis, in hospitals, doctors surgeries and on the road attending 999 calls. These types of people and calls should be put to a stop, to help our Emergency services.

attributes.action: Make all car insurers allow drivers to volunteer for the NHS, by use of the car.
attributes.background: I am shocked to learn that I am not allowed to volunteer to help the NHS by doing a volunteering job, by helping patients get to their appointments at hospital and back home. This is what they would call business use of the vehicle, and this is what I would call a breach of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: I received an email from my insurer which said: “Thank you for choosing Debenhams Car Insurance. Please note that you are not covered for carrying passengers as this is considered as business use.”

attributes.action: Let the speaker speak! A motion of the House in support of the Speaker.
attributes.background: On the 06th February the Speaker of the House of Commons spoke up to voice the views of many that President Trump not be allowed to address the House. Now he faces a no confidence motion.This petition seeks support for the debate of a counter motion of support for his position.Don't gag the Speaker!
attributes.additional_details: James Duddridge MP has sought to attack the Speaker. Over 1 million people signed a petition objecting to Trump's State visit and furthermore there is disquiet across the House regarding it. The Speaker must maintain order and preserve the dignity of the House. He was accordingly obliged to intervene when the Prime Minister elected to offer a State visit to such a divisive figure who sows discord and disorder.Let the Speaker Speak.
